content:
Hello!

I have just started implementing the TestScript evaluator.
https://github.com/beda-software/testscript-eval-py

I have been searching for open-license TestScript scenarios for the last two days with no luck. Do you know about ones?
what exactly do you mean by "TestScript scenarios"? I have Implementation guides that have had associated test scripts written for connectathons

Hi Eric.
I mean TestScript resources.
Could you please share your TestScript resources with me? Where can I find them?

if you look at any of the Da Vinci projects you should see many of them have test scripts.

for example here: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=51225442

image.png

#TestScript Resource would be the best place to ask for TestScript resource examples if that's what you're looking for, as they are fhir resources and thus should not need to be python-specific.
But also the FHIR spec has example files for TestScript https://www.hl7.org/fhir/testscript-examples.html
And also I should be able to scrounge up some more tutorial-level TestScripts if that is what you need. But again I suggest moving this over to the TestScript Resource stream.

It makes sense to move the topic to #TestScript Resource
Unfortunately, only organization owners and administrators can do this.

@Eric Haas
I am a bit concern about the copyright of Da Vinci projects TestScript resources you mentioned.
All tests has <copyright value="(c) AEGIS.net, Inc. 2019"/>
I am not sure that I may use them outside of touchstone.
I don't know the answer to that question.

AEGIS Copyright indicates that we authored the testscript. AEGIS offers the testscript as open source, freely available for use under CC0 “Creative Commons” [https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/]. AEGIS has adopted CC0 just as HL7 has done with FHIR.

But also as an FYI when I mentioned moving the conversation one thing you can do as a non-admin is just open a new conversation in the stream and then link that new conversation here to point any future readers to where the conversation shifted to.
like this: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/274423-TestScript-Resource/topic/Test.20script.20evaluator.20(Moved)
